page.title: 01 Our `D' Block
page.content: This Â£D' block is situated in east Northants, with the Bedfordshire boundary crossing the S.E.square. The county towns of Northampton and Bedford provide major centres (15-20miles away) although Wellingborough and Kettering are also important. The region falls mostly in Rushden's parish, containing many aspects which were studied i.e. industry, schools, housing and some services (these were to the east of the town.) The N.W. Km square contains Rushden's suburbs, the remaining area being mostly farmland. Housing is dispersed except for development along important roads, and the isolated village of Newton Bromswold, making transport a vital commodity.
